title: Google now lets you request removal of more personally identifiable infromation from Search
content:
Google has offered users an option to request the removal of personally identifiable information from Search for many years. Until now, this option let users request Google to remove personally identifiable information in cases of doxxing or financial fraud. But Google is now updating its policy to include other sensitive information, like personal contact information

The post Google now lets you request removal of more personally identifiable infromation from Search appeared first on XDA.
description: Google Search has updated its policy on the removal of personally identifiable information to include a couple of additional options. Read on to learn more.
